availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas B. Cooper (Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary J. Cooper. Father of John B. Cooper, David M. Cooper, Lucinda Cooper, Polly Jane Cooper, William Green Cooper, Taletha Cooper, and Thomas M. Cooper. Farmer in Morgan County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Magoffin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, p. 161B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, Licking Station, pp. 78-79.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, Precinct 2, p. 344B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Magoffin County, KY, October 1863, p. 31 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Thomas B. Cooper (1824-1901)," Memorial #83249834, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83249834 (accessed May 15, 2020).
